Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LindsayElyse01
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based off of Trip Advisor reviews and the prime location of the hotel. It was actually the first stop from the airport which was nice because we got in right away in the morning during busy traffic. We stayed on the 8th floor in a king bedroom room and it was fine for what we needed in Sydney. We were only in our room to sleep so it was just fine. I didn't hear the traffic noise that other reviewers wrote about but I was able to hear the people in the room next to ours. The shower was a bit annoying being that the water went all over the floor in the bathroom but there was a drain for it to go into and it was designed that way so it wasn't a big deal. We opted to not have our room cleaned every day we were there because we were unsure of how safe that would be. We did run into the lady that serviced our floor several times and she offered us fresh towels each morning which was perfect for us. We were a little annoyed with the internet (they said they had just switched carriers) and we were only able to use it in the lobby. You were allowed 3 hours of service a day and we went to the lobby with our laptop to send emails, etc. I guess you can't complain much being that it was FREE. The location was the best part of the hotel! It was close to Darling Harbour and we walked there every day. We bought the 24 hour ferry hopper pass that included the Taronga Zoo and we would recommend this to anyone! We also tried the Thai restaurant a block away on the same street (name of it is slipping my mind but you will see it right away) and it was delicious! We took a suggestion from someone in the hotel for a good restaurant in China Town being that we were so close and it was authentic chinese. It was good but not what we were expecting. We were able to get to Grand Central Station quickly and hopped a short train to the airport on our way out of Sydney. I would stay here again for the price and location!

Reviews.Title: “going down in standard”
Reviews.Author: personalchoice
Reviews.Content: Having stayed regularly at this hotel due to its location to Central Station.I was dissapointed as the standards have dropped and the front desk staff seem unable to solve the smallest of problems.(especially the Choice Hotels rewards programm) , telling me they were not trained etc.The room I complained about, not properley cleaned , old soap scum on floor of shower from previous guest. I purposely left old soap and shampoo containers in shower and they were still there after room had been made up. the shower floor had old soap in the groutings of the shower and the floor was slippery. I complained to the night manager of the problems of his staff etc who promised all would be well next time. Sorry !!! I will stay somewhere else. For a 4* hotel it needs to be re-classified. Also wallpaper on wall was torn ,which I reported to the day manager as soon as he had arrived. Also a cheap vynyl covered chair was was peeling at the edges.

Reviews.Title: “Colour”
Reviews.Author: Judi L
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here. The rooms were full of light with large windows which is important to me. The room was clean and the bathroom was modern and no shower curtain to contend to. the hotel is close to central so easy to walk from the bus or train. The bed was comfortable and I found staff to be polite. Air conditioning worked.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location”
Reviews.Author: travellingkiwi_11
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I wanted to be near central station to make it easy to catch public transport around the city and I found the location very convenient. I also loved the fact that the hotel is right next door to a very yummy Thai restaurant. I paid a bit extra to get an executive room because they are on the upper floors and are quieter. You still hear traffic and street noise at night but it's not too bad. The soundproofing between rooms wasn't great. It was good having some free daily wireless internet time included in the room rate. The room was okay, nothing special, but it was clean and the bed was comfy and it had everything I needed. The roof top pool looked fabulous although I didn't get a chance to use it. Buffet breakfast was average. Staff were generally helpful. I would consider staying again just because of the handy location.

Reviews.Title: “The place actually improves the longer you stay ...”
Reviews.Author: JNCC
Reviews.Content: They got off to a bad start by demanding a photo ID. Maybe I'm just being unreasonably picky but if the pub's got your credit card number and can charge things to this, why do they need ID? Anyway I was tired and grumpy so perhaps that was a factor. Nothing wrong with the room however. Big, comfortable king size bed, efficient use of space, internet access easy and quick, and a decent sized bathroom (but oddly, the toilet was in a sort of door-less walled stall). Quiet despite being on a seriously busy intersection near Central Station. Easy to reach from the airport train and the bus stops are about 100 metres in George St. About a 20 minute walk to Darling Harbour through China Town. The price was reasonable for what was offered. If you haven't stayed here and want a hotel accessible to public transport, this is a good option. But hey, Sydney's full of decent hotels so don't take this one unless it's really in your right price range and where you want to be.

Reviews.Title: “Waste of Money!!! Do NOT stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Alokeelo
Reviews.Content: My stay here was terrible what more can I say. The location accords the road from Central seemed ideal but when I arrived just outside the front door there were a group of drunken aboriginals who every time I walked out the front door was surrounded by the same group of men heckled me for money and being a sole female traveler it didn't make me feel safe - I brought this up with the front desk and was told quite rudely that it wasn't their problem. The room was filthy there was hair and dirt in the bedding the shower still had the soap and soap scum most likely from the previous guest and the crockery in the room was not cleaned , no safe in your room to store valuables, no extra lock on the door which is standard in most Sydney hotels. The television did not work and waited 2 hours for someone came up the front desk claimed that they were busy but on the four occasions I walked down to the lobby both reception staff were just standing there avoiding eye contact with me - eventually someone came up and told me they cannot fix it I asked to see if I can move to another room and was told its against policy to do that. After this I was fed up with the situation and cancelled the rest of my booking and was told upon check out tha I had to pay a cancellation fee which I gladly did two weeks after getting home I was charged on my credit card the two nights accomadation I cancelled - which I paid the cancellation charge for at the moment I'm still waiting to hear back from the reservations team I keep ringing, when I do get through to a consultant I get put on hold as they seem to always search for a manager I ask for his/her name but the reply is ill put you through to my manager. I'm currently seeking advice from the Australian Office of Fair Trading on what to do next.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: AdamR_12
Reviews.Content: All the bad reviews about this hotel are TRUE !!! Absolutely the worst hotel experience, filthy stained blankets and bath towels were a grey dirty colour. Rooms are very small and the website has deceptive photos. No such thing as a premier triple, this is a lie, it's a standard room with 2 beds and a fold out stood upright against the wall !! Dark dingy bathroom with no ceiling fan, no shower door with water flooding the entire floor in the small bathroom. Do not stay at this hotel, not worth the money only 2 star at best. Hopefully this review will save someone from booking this hotel and save them from ruining their holiday. It certainly ruined our holiday. Would never stay here again. Horrible, horrible, horrible !!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just misses "the mark"”
Reviews.Author: Jqqls
Reviews.Content: Perfectly adequate in most ways, and I'm just nit~picking over a couple of things, really. Small en~suite, and although I opted to keep my towel, I *dumped* a face cloth, which wasn't replaced over two days (three day stay). The *milk* was those itty bitty things, and there were a total of four allocated each day, which meant *one* cup of milky coffee, or stinting on the amount I like to have. What's wrong with ensuring there are adequate amounts for as many cups a day as one could want??? Otherwise... it was fine, really, and very conveniently positioned for public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, room and value”
Reviews.Author: mrodri81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights and it was a good stay. The room was big and comfortable. the hotel was very quiet and this was key to have a good night sleep after a 25 hour journey to Sydney. It was good value for money. Based on the edge of chinatown, it is 10 min walk to Darling Harbour and 20 min walk to the circular quay and opera house. It is conveniently situated opposite the central station with great connections to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: aussievoyageur
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced. Rooms are good size and well furnished, but lack a safe. The hotel is in a convenient location in the sense that it's easy to get public transport, however it's not an interesting or fun area for visitors. The lobby can do with a bit more atmosphere. At $24 the breakfast is rather tired.

Reviews.Title: “The Armpit of Chinatown, Sydney”
Reviews.Author: melissaw6226
Reviews.Content: Where do I even start?.. From the minute that we walked into The Marque Hotel, we were stunned by how much we had been deceived, based on the appearance and description of the hotel on its website. It is true that the hotel is somewhat centrally located in the southern region of Sydney; it is about a 15 minute walk from Darling Harbour, which has many shops and delicious restaurants, but it is located in the center of Chinatown, and if you are not interested in eating Asian food, you should expect to walk a good 15-20 minutes to either Darling Harbour. Our initial impression of the room was that it was a decent size and that it had the amenities that we were looking for. When we entered the room, it took us about 15 minutes to figure out how to even turn on a light; you must insert your room key into the wall in order to operate the lights and the air conditioner, but there are no directions whatsoever to explain to this to you. After our 22 hour trip from the US, all we wanted to do was take a shower. When we did, we were quickly alarmed with the noise that the shower was making. The website describes that each room has a rain shower, so we were excited to use it, but within a minute of doing so, the shower head was making a ridiculous noise that sounds similar to drilling. We brought this issue to the front desk, who offered to send up a maintenance worker. When we arrived at our room, he looked at the shower and after we told him to wait a minute or so while the water ran, he not only told us that were wasting water, but that the sound wasnâ€™t a problem. He said that it was most likely the sound of air exiting the shower head, and that it should go away within a minute or so. Let me tell you, we have been here for almost a week, and the sound has not only been a part of every shower that we have taken, but the water pressure and temperature changes along with the noise. The maintenance worker did not offer to come back if the sound persisted, and the front desk did not even bother to follow up with this issue. For a hotel that promises a â€œsoothingâ€� and â€œdivineâ€� rain shower experience, I feel as if I have been taking a shower in a thunderstorm for the past few days. If you are bringing important belongings (jewelry, passports, electronics), expect to be using a safe behind the front desk. There are no safes in the rooms, but they do offer personal safes at no cost if you wish to secure your items up front. The boxes are small though, so be aware that you can fit no more than a few small items within them. I am not sure how safe I actually feel putting my important personal items behind the reception desk, considering there have been multiple occasions in which we have been in the lobby where the desk was left unattended. The website states that the hotel offers Foxtel and Satellite television, and although that may be true, do not expect more than 3-6 channels. I must say though, I am happily surprised that the hotel offers free, 24 hour internet access, and that they provide an Ipod docking station and refrigerator for your convenience. On the other hand, there is no â€œpeep holeâ€� on the door, so we were not comfortable opening the door when hotel staff came to the room. We actually put our ironing board against the door at night because we were unsure of how well the door was locking since it wasnâ€™t a normal lock. If these issues werenâ€™t enough to turn you off from staying at this hotel, you will be unhappy to hear that the staff here is not only completely incompetent in providing solutions to any issues that are presented to them, but they have absolutely NO knowledge of anything within proximity to the hotel; they were unable to inform us of any restaurants, shops, excursions, etc. and there are limited brochures that are offered to guests when inquiring about things to do in the area. We eventually got fed up and booked the climb on our own within 5 minutes. We have had to go to multiple shops, restaurants, and even other hotels to ask about directions or suggestions on where to go. In my opinion, that is absolutely unacceptable to have to do when one is staying at a hotel that claims that they go â€œabove and beyondâ€� for their guests. When we tried to book our Bridge Climb excursion, one of the staff members did not know what the climb was, and he took about 45 minutes to try and book the excursion. We were going to confront the hotel staff at the end of our stay and discuss our unhappiness with our experience here, but after calling down for a bar of soap and being told that I had to go down myself and get it after 9pm, I had decided to express my concerns immediately. I was told that there is only one person at the desk and that any services that I needed after this time had to be taken care of on my own; I have never heard of this at a â€œfour-starâ€� hotel. As I walked downstairs to get my soap, a couple had walked in, looking for a room to stay in at the hotel. After they had been turned away due to full occupancy, they decided to linger in the lobby and discuss their other options. At this point, I decided to bring up to the staff how disappointed I have been so far with the hotel. Not only did the staff member not address any of our concerns or offer any guidance or solutions, but he rudely tried to dismiss the couple when they overheard our concerns and tried to help us solve our problems; he told them to leave and that he wasnâ€™t going to listen to them because they werenâ€™t staying at the hotel. This is an absolutely disgusting response from a person working in the hospitality industry. Little does he know that even though she isnâ€™t staying at the hotel, she is probably telling everyone she knows not to stay here. On day 4, we finally met the manager of the hotel and we expressed our issues and concerns and even told him that we were considering switching hotels. He apologized sincerely and gave us complimentary breakfast for the rest of our stay. Although he accommodated us, I would stay not stay here again, or recommend the hotel to others. Because we live in the US, we were not able to call the hotel before arriving and inquire about the amenities because of costly expenses due to international fees. Therefore, we strongly relied on The Marque website in making our decision to stay here. Do yourself a favor, and DO NOT stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: ChrisGibbs
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent had booked this hotel for our 3 night stay on a Room Only basis. The staff were very accommodating and the room clean and tidy. A choice could be had at breakfast between full and continental at $24 and $18 respectively. Both appeared good value. The hotel is ideally situated close to the central railway station from where you can use the transport station to get down to the Circular Quay. Overall a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good overall, good location”
Reviews.Author: annabellet
Reviews.Content: Room and bathroom were nice. Was there for 3 nights on business. Comfy bed. Location was good, easy access to Central station (great for getting airport train). Easy walk to Darling Harbour and Chinatown. What made my stay a 3 star rating instead of 4 was that on our floor there had obviously been some kind of water leak, and they had just covered the carpet in the corridor with cardboard which was mouldy and rotting, and it stayed that way the entire time I was there. Very bizarre. So it smelt really musty when you came out of the lift. Didnt affect the room though. Also couldnt get wifi working in our room, had to go down to lobby. Rooftop pool was good for a quick dip but area overall wasnt that great, broken chairs etc. I think for the price it wasnt great value, but having said that... where is in Sydney?!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jennifergill107
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here for 3 nights and I really enjoyed my stay. The rooms are very clean spacious and comfortable. The location is great, just across from central station and also across from the main bus stop. The food was ok, breakfast was average but dinner was excellent. Would come back again

Reviews.Title: “Stay Anywhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: Don B
Reviews.Content: What a dump. How they got 4 stars from the NRMA rating agency is beyond me. The first room they tried to put me in had no working air conditioning, they claimed it "just broke", but why was there a fan in there? Lies. The second room had air conditioning but in the middle of the night it started rattling like crazy. The windows do not block out the traffic, it sounded like i was staying in the middle of an intersection. The curtains do not close properly so the light comes in at sunrise to disturb sleep even further. When I came down to the front desk and told them the room was crap and I didn't want to stay here a second night, the response was "oh your room was prepaid so... goodbye then." The only positives are that the shower is nice and the room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good position for sightseeing but don't book for the rooftop pool!”
Reviews.Author: MrsSmith83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marque for 2 nights in Feb 2012 for some sightseeing around Sydney. The staff were generally friendly and the room was fine but certainly nothing special. The bathroom was very clean and modern. We went up to the rooftop pool to relax for an hour and were really disappointed with this area. The sun beds were all broken and the patio area was on one level with the pool kind of just plonked on top of everything - bit odd and not somewhere that you could find particularly relaxing! If you are a light sleeper then I wouldn't really recommend as it's on a very busy junction. I didn't think it would bother us but it was noisier than I thought. We also booked a patio room but that really wasn't worth it as it was a dingy concrete area with a high wall so you can't see anything of the views. Although the view was just the busy road! The patio rooms are also only on the 3rd floor so it wouldn't get any better. The hotel is in a good position as it's about a 10 min walk to Darling Harbour and the new Darling Quarter which is a fab area with some great restaurants. You can also walk all the way up George street to Circular Quay area or jump on one of the forms of public transport. Would recommend but don't set your expectations too high.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: llightn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights before taking a cruise. This hotel is perfectly located for exploring Sydney since it's only a couple blocks distance from the central train station where you can take local trains or the light rail to any point in the city. For example a short train ride to Darling Harbor puts you at the Ferry terminals, at the Opera House and the Rocks area. The hotel is a quick walking distance to Paddy's Market, a fun Asian shopping experience. The remodeled hotel is in great shape, bathrooms just right, and the desk representatives helpful. Big bonus - free internet!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Pratt
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Marque Hotel for one night in February 2012. I basically chose the Marque as it was the least expensive option within a reasonable distance of Central, but was pleasantly surprised. Staff were pleasant, casual and friendly, with an efficient check in despite it being a busy time of day when I arrived. My room (901) was reasonably fitted out, spacious and clean. The room had all the usual bits and pieces, as well as an iron and full sized ironing board. Mini bar was very expensive and they didn't stretch to the usual free bottle of water....if you wanted it, you had to pay! The bathroom was small, but the 'rain shower' a pleasant surprise in this era of water saving. It was nice to have a 'real' shower in an Australian hotel for a change! Overall, the Marque is a good option in Sydney if you can get it for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “great location!”
Reviews.Author: DonnaandMaurice
Reviews.Content: We arrived from a very long international flight to get to the hotel and be met by a smiling staff memeber who had us organized very quickly so we could get something to eat and go to bed! The location was excellent! close to paddy's market and plenty of food places. Breakfast was good but would have been even better if it had been included in the cost of our room($18 - $23 for contiental/buffet). We thought the hotel nice but seems to need quiet alot of upgrading as marks on the wall had rubbed the paint off and stains on carpet, also lounges in pool area had holes in them and fell apart when we tried to lay down on them. For the price we paid and the location we had with the bonus of friendly, helpful staff plus a bed that I wanted to take home!,made this a very enjoyable stay though. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big clean rooms, best value in Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: hotelcheckers
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a few hotels in sydney, this is by far the best value for money. We stayed here 8 nights and really loved this hotel. It's modern, service is so friendly and warm, the rooftop pool and terrace was awsome with great views of the city skyline. Room service is great. The bathroom is excellent with rain shower heads and French connection toiletries.The location is perfect, walking distance to Darling Harbour and right next to Railway square which connects you to all the beaches & popular areas in sydney. You do hear a bit of the traffic, but that's normal in all the hotels or private accomodation in sydney. 3 hours/day free internet is also included. Their prices are extremely good, I looked around at lots of different hotels and this is by far the best for business or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Henryjen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and were very happy with both the location and the comfortable room with it's clean and modern decor. We took a train from the Int. Airport to Central Station, then it was a short walk to the hotel. The staff at reception were friendly and helpful. We were a bit disappointed when we walked out of the lift on the ninth floor, as there was a strong smell of damp mildew, which we discovered was due to a leak from the roof top! Drying the carpet quickly would have avoided this. However, our room was fresh and clean, with a comfortable king size bed. We liked the location because we could walk to Darling Harbour or downtown Sydney but it was also easy to catch a train or bus if you didn't have the time. The Capitol Theatre was also close by, where we saw the wonderful 'Love never Dies' We had breakfast each morning in the restaurant which was enjoyable. The swimming pool on the roof top was a let-down. The chairs and loungers had holes in them, the whole area needs a revamp.

Reviews.Title: “JUST A TOUCH UP”
Reviews.Author: off2cdaworld
Reviews.Content: Stayed four days .. The hotel is right by Central Rail Station as well as the crossing of George Street, Pitt and more which creates a very busy intersection .. you can get a 555 bus right by Central station for free which will take you to the Rocks and Circular Quay .. return .. FREE .. good choice!! Walking distance to Paddinton Market for interesting shopping as well as awesome Asian food on the top floor .. check UAE money exchange as they won't rip you off and give you great exchange rate too!! Street car to Darling Harbour right by market too!! Staff very very helpful and will book shuttle back to International Airport .. cheaper than train too!! Breki is okay .. rooms have lots of space and free wifi was nice .. bathroom is a challenge as it is a boutique thingee with no shower door so you have to be quick so you don't flood the place .. did not like at all!! The overall cost of stay was too pricey but there are many over priced hotels in the Sydney area!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't complain, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cam86nz
Reviews.Content: We were staying here for a week recently. Its in a great spot, being at the top of george street and very very close to transport. We didnt need to cross the road to get to central station as we could use underground subways to get to the station. The room was cleaned well each day, except for one day when the cleaner was a bit lazy, but never mind it was cleaned the next day. The aircon in the room was our best friend as it was blinking hot. We had a city-facing room. For people who are light sleepers or sensative to noise, you might find this hotel a little bit noisy. The road outside is extremely busy 24 hours a day and often sirens and loud cars could be heard. We weren't overly bothered and still had great sleeps. The bed was just fantastic, a nice king size bed. We will stay here next time we are in Sydney

Reviews.Title: “Good location, big room, central”
Reviews.Author: saraht1987
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this hotel, it's in a very central location (right on Central Station), close to Chinatown, you can walk everywhere or just jump on the train. Travelled for business so chose it predomintely because it was close to where I needed to be, but I was really happy with the room. Bed was super comfy, and the room was a good size. Had drinks with a friend in the bar, nothing too flash, but was still good! Would come back.

Reviews.Title: “good base”
Reviews.Author: saraelise22
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice and modern. Really close location to central station. A 15 min or so walk to darling harbour - but about a 40 min walk down george st to the opera house etc. Next time we will probably stay more central as we walked everywhere rather than taking public transport. The price was decent considering as we booked early and got a discount. The weather was average so we didn't get to swim in the pool - which was one of the main reasons we booked the hotel. It was very windy up on the roof top. Overall a clean and nice place to stay while being out most of the day looking around Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Food”
Reviews.Author: chris_prosser
Reviews.Content: I have reviewed this hotel before for the excellent service, I have stayed here many times and am constantly impressed with the level of service by the friendly staff. However, until recently I have always wondered into China Town to eat, but during my last couple of stays have found the food in the hotel dining room for dinner to be of a very high standard. The menu is not vast, but the quality of the food is outstanding. I am not normally a big fan of hotel food, but the Marque dining is definately worth a try!

Reviews.Title: “Handy, Modern and Well Priced”
Reviews.Author: Wanderering1
Reviews.Content: This is a well positioned property which gives excellent access to the Sydney transport system, including trains to the airport, the suburbs and/or the wider NSW network. The hotel is across the road from the station but has no railway noise problems. It also provides excellent access to Chinatown. One particularly refreshing approach by management is that the minibar prices are fair to the customer in comparison to other hotels, worldwide, who want hold patrons to ransom with their prices. The staff were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good price”
Reviews.Author: NSWChris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently to attend the Sydney Festival. We got a special deal including parking, breakfast and 3 hours free internet. The location was fantastic and close to transport. The room we had was a refurbished one and everything was new. The room was quite large and very quiet (we were on the 9th floor). The breakfast was OK and the service was friendly and helpful. We had a late check out and they were happy for us to leave the car in the carpark after we had checked out. I would recommend this hotel for a trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “So much better than my expected..”
Reviews.Author: CKeesing
Reviews.Content: I read some reviews before I made the booking. A bit worried about the homeless people outside the hotel and the traffic noise outside. But it turned ot to be the opposite. No homeless people at all and we were in room 501, opposite the traffic. We had a very nice stay, the bed was comfortable, nice and clean bathroom, fluffy white towels, the staff members were very friendly and helpful. I will come back and recommend this hotel. CK

Reviews.Title: “Good professional hotel in convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Alice_Steve_B
Reviews.Content: Located opposite Central train station, it was convenient to catch the train straight from the airport. It's a also a hop and a skip to Market City and Chinatown. And being walkers, it was also possible to have a meander through the urban, tower-lined streets to Darling Harbour in one direction and Hyde Park and the Royal Botanic Gardens in another. Staff at the hotel were efficient and professional. One receptionist gave us an excellent tip on which bar to go to for cocktail specials at Darling Harbour! Room, ensuite and toiletries are very nice. Only complaint was that on our first night there, the window had been left slightly open and it was quite noisy with traffic through the night. When we notified staff, it was quickly remedied but either the windows weren't double-glazed or the glazing was faulty but traffic noise was inevitable for the 3 nights we were there.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: kojak069
Reviews.Content: ive stayed at this hotel a number of times it is close to most things with central railway station across the road and bus stops are just a minutes walk away. Darling Harbour and china town are only a short walk. The rooms are clean and comfortable,food is a little pricey but there are so many places nearby to eat at, you can also park at the hotel if you have a car. I would stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Marque Hotel, Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Sharon I
Reviews.Content: We were impressed by the location, the friendly staff, the quality of the room, the proximity of nearby restaurants, the rates. We would definitely stay at this place again and would have no hesitation recommending it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: edwynr
Reviews.Content: Location is the best thing about this hotel hotel particularly for visitors - you can get to anywhere conveniently. they have adequate parking too if you have a car. they were rooms were good and spacious for a hotel of it's class. while the room was clean overall, the quality and efficiency of house keeping was a little suspect.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better choice hotels”
Reviews.Author: aus_isis
Reviews.Content: This was far better than most choice hotels. Rooms had been refurbished with nice fittings. Very clean. 3 hrs free internet was a bonus. Under cover parking which was a bit expensive. No gym. I didn't head the trains.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice renovated room.”
Reviews.Author: Hoteletsgo
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2nights at Marque mid Dec, was a good stay, room was nicely renovated, morden and clean. Room was spacious, but the TV was not as good as a hotel suppose to have, very few channels and most of them were fuzzy. The biggest problem is noise level from the street, but such a central location cannot avoid this. Staff were good, but not the one checked me out, maybe he was tired from overnight shift. Overall is great, will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay”
Reviews.Author: SandraEd
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights early Dec 2011 and was pleased with the quality of the amenities. Rooms fresh & clean and nice bathroom.Modern TV and air con. Easy walking distance to Central Station, right on George St, buses straight down to the CBD. 2 mins walk to Paddys Market and the Light Rail. Plenty of eateries. All clean & fresh. Ask tho for rooms NOT facing George St as they are noisy. Annoyed with their policy of asking to hold a $200 fee in case you damage anything or use the mini bar. But otherwise it was better value & much more modern than Aarons Hotel nearby that I stayed at in Oct.. I would stay here again but would never stay again at Aarons.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean”
Reviews.Author: sldingman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little bit away from the center of town, but a very nice hotel. We requested a top floor and they gave us the highest floor. The rooms were very clean and nice. For the price this hotel is worth every penny. The walls and ceiling had cracks in them, but overall I would definitely stay here again. The staff was very helpful and friendly. They recommended a restaurant next door that was so good we ate there twice!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, competitive and contemporary”
Reviews.Author: Cocoda-Cambridge
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 days and found teh Marque very comfortable. OK, it's not 5* in its service, ammenities or style, but at this price, it would be hard to fault this hotel. Other reviewers have commented on the noise, but did not find this a problem - it's in the heart of Sydney, so deal with it! Todd on Reception warrants special mention as the perfect 'host', well done fella. Plenty of good restaurants nearby, Paddy's Market for all those souveniers too. All in all, more than perfectly adequate, especially given the price and location. Pool great with stunning views. Really have no grounds to grumble whatsoever and would stay again (though may be with a balcony room).

Reviews.Title: “All we expected... plus cockroaches!”
Reviews.Author: OzAsh7614
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights ago for an evening out in the city. The room was nice enough. The shower and bed were incredible however I was shocked to find small cockroaches in the cupboard around the kettle and bar food. I reported this to reception who did nothing except eventually head up to the room to spray the area. They didn't even seem embarrassed about it. Unfortunately I have booked another room at this hotel in December but am wondering if I should just cancel. One would think that a hotel charging what they do for the rooms could at least afford some basic pest control.

Reviews.Title: “Good for price, central ststion”
Reviews.Author: ladyfitch
Reviews.Content: If you need to be near central this is a good nice. Modern, refurbed, big rooms with huge beds and lcds. Bathrooms are spotless, rooms starting to show some signs of wear and tear. No gym, main complaint. Staff friendly and accomodating, room service is quite tasty and well priced. Wouldn't stay there unless I wanted to catch the train in for the airport as a method of killing time and wanted to drop my stuff there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location and Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: rainyh
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in August 2011. Location:- Near to Central Station and Chinatown. Interior:- Clean with daily room make up; Toiletries are from FCUK. Food:- Ordered breakfast room services twice and food was not warm enough. The cafe downstairs (charlie) offers excellent breakfast selection at reasonable prices. Rating was given based on the good location and newly furnished room.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely refurbished, great location, sound city hotel”
Reviews.Author: brisgooner
Reviews.Content: I booked Marque through bookings.com (a better rate than wotif, which is unusual in my experience), and hadn't stayed there before. It's a reasonable price, but not the bargain of the century. Location is very central, right next to Central Station. This has obvious advanatges, but also some disadvantages. The area around George St and Broadway is a bit grubby and there are occasional diversions of homeless people and other interesting Sydney characters in the vicinity. Nothing dreadful occurs, but it might mean some interesting explanations if you're travelling with children. Inside the hotel has been refurbsihed very nicely. Reception staff are brisk, efficient and friendly. I didn't try the bar / restaurant but it looked quite nice. My room was on Level 3 and it again was newly refurbed. It was a bit weird though in that there is no external window and no natural light. There was a window in the corner of very thick glass, after some judicious squinting it looked like that window opened onto another room. Not 100% sure on that, but it felt a bit odd. The overall feeling of the room was therefore a bit claustrophobic - I'd suggest asking for a room higher up or on the outside of the hotel. Air con was a pain as well - they have split systems and this one blew straight onto the bed, and didn't seem to have a setting between "arctic gale" and "off". I am not super-efficient with these though, so a normal person might have done better. Overall, not a bad stay, would stay again - but would ask for another room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel close to train station”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_UK_09
Reviews.Content: Only stayed in this hotel for one night but it was pleasant. Was pretty close to the Central station which was convenient. The check in process was quick, the decor was pretty good in the room, small bathroom but nice walk in shower. Cons were the king size bed is 2 singles pushed together which isn't really king size is it... Had a good sleep no noisy traffic despite (our room facing the traffic on the 4th floor) and no noisy neighbours! If you want to stay close to a station this is a convenient and pleasant hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Noisey, clean rooms, beds are nice, customer service needs attention”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell_UK_19
Reviews.Content: We reviewed the hotels comments on trip advisor before we went travelling, and this hotel came up with quite a lot of good comments, so booked it for our initial 5 day stay and the 3 day stay at the end of the holiday before flying home. The hotel its-self is ok, beds were HUGE! Location was brilliant (train station is right outside the hotel) The NOISE is immense! SOOOOOO busy and VERY noisey no matter which side you stay in. The swimming pool was ok, but cold. Some staff were rude - and didnt have the can do attitude. Rates were average for Sydney - it was brilliant for the market 5 minutes away - and situated right in China town so if you like that kind thing its brill. Felt safe walking around which was good. From the hotel to Circular Quay walking it was around 40-45 minutes or you can jump on a tram

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: roisinc_11
Reviews.Content: Last minute deal. Fab location, room was fine. Todd at reception was fantastic. Would recommend highly

Reviews.Title: “Very good city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travellingirl58
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 week. location is excellent for sightseeing,train and bus routes. Staff were always helpful and polite. Room was large for a city, bed very comfortable and bed linen, towels and toiletries were of good quality. It was a bit noisy but it is a city so to be expected. Lots of restaurants and shops nearby if you didn't want to walk too far. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better-than-average city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hoppy912
Reviews.Content: This is a clean, modern, spacy hotel with excellent proximity to Sydney's Central station. I do have some complaints: from my online booking I had thought there was 3 hours of free wi-fi per day per room. When I rang to connect they don't have wi-fi, only wired Internet, and I wasn't able to connect to that by the instructions of staff so I just gave up. Also, the rooms facing George St are incredibly NOT noise-resistant - you can hear the traffic screaming past at all hours of the night. If this was my hotel I'd definately be investing in better glassing or something. However, the rooms are beautiful, the bed was comfortable, and the rain shower to die for. On the whole, I'd stay here again during the week but wouldn't dare over a weekend for fear of the night scene noise. If I stayed again I'd request a room not overlooking the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: jofarmer7
Reviews.Content: We arrived early expecting to drop off our luggage and come back later to check in. However, the staff member was very nice and informed us we could check in and have access to our room. That was an excellent start. The room was clean, tidy, small but all we needed for a night's rest. The hotel is in a great location, near the train station, shopping and plenty of food choices. The free bus ride within the city can take you to all the further tourist locations which is a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: DANA20
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at this hotel. location very good - across a busy road juncion from the bus & train station. Turn left ouside the hotel & walk for 5 mins to find Paddys market - if you want to buy typical touristy stuff this is where you should go. Same items near the harbour area are twice the price. Ate in the hotel on our first night and the food was OK. Met family from Sydney who took us to Surrey Hills area for food on our second night and quality & price was excellent - think it was the Shakespeare hotel. Trains go straight from station to Circular Quay. We took hop on hop off bus on the first day to get our bearings. Staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly worn but great overall”
Reviews.Author: Shy2Fly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - close to central station which is great as you can get to the Opera House, Bondi Junction, etc via return train journey for $5. You can get to Darling Harbour, City Centre Westfield (for shopping!) via Monorail for $10 (all day pass, hop on hop off). The reception is light and airy, the staff are professional and extremely knowledgeable of the area. There is a restaurant within the hotel (which I dodn't try so cannot comment). There are laundry facilities ($2.20 for a wash $2 for a dry) and a swimming pool and sauna. The rooftop pool was clean and spacious, the pool clean. The sauna (rooftop) again was clean and...well its a sauna, what else can I say? Getting to the rooftop involved climbing a flight of stairs so if you have a disability, etc please keep this in mind. Also I wouldn't fancy having a room on the 12th floor as this is where the stairs are for rooftop access. My room was clean and light. There was some noise from the street (9th floor) but then again you are in a busy central location so what can you expect? The bathroom was great, and well stocked with towels and French Connection toiletries. The shower could do with an additional side panel to stop the floor getting soaked but this is a minor point - if you don't have the shower on full blast I am sure its fine. You are a five minute walk from Paddys Markets / Markey City. There is a wide range of eateries close to the hotel - side bar (hostel) at the junction, KFC, McDonalds, Sumo Salad, Gloria Jeans coffee house, Seven Eleven, etc all outside your door. You can also grab Chinese food on your way back from the train (as I did). There is a good selection of TV available for those lazy nights and 3 hours of free wifi daily which is a nice touch. I would say the hotel is slightly tired - carpet worn in some areas, a fresh lick of paint as the corridors are very dark (charcoal colour with dark carpets). Overall though, I really enjoyed my stay here and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Deal!”
Reviews.Author: Kathiiy
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here for one night whilst in Sydney for a concert. We chose the Marque as we wanted to be close to the train station. I LOVE the location. Being just across from central station is such a good place to be, especially if you are travelling to other suburbs and don't want to take the car. Booking through the website we got a great deal, $165 for one night in a king room, with car parking included (usually $35) and a buffet breakfast for both of us (usually $20 each). Plus the staff were friendly and the room was clean, and the bed was comfortable and I read on a sign somewhere that you get three hours internet usage for free. We also took a trip up to the pool deck, and can see it would be a nice place to be in the summer. Although I am not a fan of the 'hotel room', usually preferring apartment accommodation, I would certainly stay here again if I could get the same deal. Without the deal, it's just another hotel room. Also, like other people have said, there is traffic noise, but it didn't stop me sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Kyiha
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a Saturday night at the Marque. The location was amazing, so close to everything. The staff were great from the moment we arrived. Late during the evening we rang reception to complain about the room next door, and they handled it professionally and promptly. Only downside to hotel is I thought the canapes were over rated. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a clean, modern, well priced hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was great, especially Bee at reception”
Reviews.Author: Patricia P
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful 5 night visit that was both business and pleasure. While this end of George St may not be considered the classiest part of the city, it was really convenient for us with the major transport options all within easy walking distance. The room was spacious and well appointed with a very comfy bed, large bathroom and daily servicing that included replenishing of amenities. All the staff were friendly and helpful, especially Bee on reception, who went out of her way to solve issues for us. They offer 3 hours free internet every day and free local phone calls - which could easily save $30 per night. I'd stay here again in a flash, especially in summer when it would be bliss to spend an afternoon lounging by the rooftop pool.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome service!”
Reviews.Author: Mpyo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a week and loved it. The room was nice and clean. The flat screen was kind of small but we weren't there to watch tv so it didn't matter too much. The front desk was super helpful with whatever we needed. We were initially placed in a room facing another building but we asked for a street facing room which we were given, on a higher floor! Our friends that we traveled with were given a similar room on a different floor and their room was equally nice. The front desk printed out maps and directions to specific places we wanted to visit. Great rooftop pool and viewing area. Only downside was they were fully booked on the last night of our trip so we had to switch hotels... However we knew this when booking the hotel so it's not their fault...we will stay there on future visits definitely!

Reviews.Title: “no worries”
Reviews.Author: HollyMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff; courteous and proficient. Room clean and neat. Bed comfortable. Location brilliant. Value for money outstanding. The down side was the noise. I did not enjoy listening to next doorâ€™s TV. This is a refurbished building and although it looks great the thin walls are just not up to todayâ€™s standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & very modern”
Reviews.Author: travel_fan_aussie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night and had a great time. The staff were very friendly on check-in, and the room we had was perfect - king size bed, air con, nice bathroom with French Connection products, and everything was very new and modern. We didn't hear any noise from other rooms, or the street, and the breakfast was good in the restaurant. We asked what time check out was, and was told it is normally 10.30 but they could give us an extra half an hour so we checked out at 11am which was perfect for us. I'd recommend the Marque for it's awesome location - directly opposite Central station, close to Surry Hills, China Town and Darling Harbour, as well as Town Hall for shopping. There is a pool on the roof which was small but would be lovely in the summer - great views of the city from there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean”
Reviews.Author: JCTraveller2011
Reviews.Content: Even though our room was facing busy George St and Central station, the dull humm of traffic was OK. Rooms are clean and bright and the Drive & Stay package that includes parking and Breakfast was good value for a city hotel of this quality.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: sammygirl_10
Reviews.Content: Marque Hotel in Sydney is conveniently located very near the train station so it's easy to get transportation to attractions that we visited. Hotel facilities and services are average. Free internet connection for a number of hours. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern well equipped hotel”
Reviews.Author: DipaP
Reviews.Content: Good rooms with modern facilities (hairdryer is included). They are quite spacious. The corridors are however quite grim and grey and do not reflect the hotel itself. Staff are very helpful and are more than willing to confirm any tours you may have booked. Although the hotel is situated on the main road (George Street), it is at the other end to Circular Quays etc so takes about a 40minute walk to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay to explore Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: HayleyandSuze
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was spotless and very comfortable to stay in. Great location for walking around to explore and central station just across the road. Would definitely stay here again, and we would also look for Marque hotels in other locations as a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Islanda
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Marque due to its location - it is literally just across the road from central station. Travelling with young kids and no car seats, we wanted the convenience of train travel and we wanted somewhere close to the station so that we didn't have to haul our luggage too far! The Marque turned out to be perfect for our family. It was a 5 min walk to Paddy's Markets and the Monorail station, about 10 mins to the Power house museum, and about 15 mins to Darling Harbour (or a quick monorail ride). There were a lot of things to do to entertain the kids and if we needed to go a bit further afield, central station was also at our doorstep. The rooms were very comfortable and seemed to be newly renovated. We only ate in the restaurant for breakfast and found it to be very reasonably priced. The bar had a trendy and intimate atmosphere, and we enjoyed a few drinks here catching up with a friend. The staff were very friendly and helpful. It was no trouble to store our luggage for a few hours while we did some last minute sight seeing on our last day. All in all we had a very pleasant stay, and we would definitely stay here again on our next trip to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: na0mic
Reviews.Content: This hotel was straight accross the road from Central Station and a five minute walk from Darling Harbour so really good location for transport and events. Also a range of cafes and healthy food options just out the door

Reviews.Title: “terrific spot, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: roger2300
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in Sydney at the Marque...it's a great location (across the road from Central Station and buses galore and close to Chinatown and Paddy's market) and the staff were very friendly and efficient. Our room (high up and at rear) was as quiet as a church. Definitely a great spot for Sydney. Roger from St Andrews.

Reviews.Title: “I return on a regular basis for the best service!”
Reviews.Author: chris_prosser
Reviews.Content: Without exception, ALL the staff at the Marque are very attentive and friendly, making it a pleasure to stay here. Nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are always immaculately clean, and well serviced. The restaurant is pleasant and the standard of food is very good. The location is also good for Central Station, China Town and Darling Harbour. Considering all of the above, for the price it would be very difficult to find better.

Reviews.Title: “Worst weekend of my life, horrible hotel.”
Reviews.Author: theresa_nichols
Reviews.Content: This was the worst weekend I ever had, the worst hotel I have ever stayed at. I got married and stayed here friday night 24 June along with my brother, husband, maid of honour and her partner. Nothing went to plan, I requested my credit card be charged for my brothers stay, I sent through a credit card authorization and called up to ensure it was recieved, they assured me it was and that it was fine, my brother was charged on his check out and apprently they lost the email I sent. My maid of honour was put in the wrong room, she was charged for breakfast even though it was included in her deal and she already paid for it, she never got the wine and canapes that were ordered and also paid for. My brother was put in a single room with a single bed even though we reserved a king room for him. My brother requested myself be upgraded to a suite and that never happened also. I will never stay again and have put in a complaint in writing, nothing about this hotel was positive. I regret coming here and it ruined my wedding weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Crystalkae
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel during our honeymoon vacation. The hotel is situated near Central station, so we had easy access to the city's public transportation. Continental breakfast was also provided as part of our room rate, however, the selection was not that great. The staff was very helpful, accommodating and friendly. Cons - Outdated decor, smelly 12th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, noisy, noisy!”
Reviews.Author: coffee01
Reviews.Content: Having undergone a complete refurbishment, you would expect this hotel to have installed sound-proofing to at least reduce the noise from the busy road outside to a dull hum! We stayed on the 4th floor for 3 nights and didn't get a wink of sleep. Even at 3am the traffic was roaring past, and the screaming and shouting from the backpackers' opposite went on into the early hours. The refurbishment is, I'm sure, an improvement, but the bathroom is effectively a wet room as there's no door on the shower (which is one of those fixed, rain-shower type heads - you either love them or hate them). The bedroom was a reasonable size and the bed was comfy but the mattress didn't smell too good - like a dog had slept in it! The reception, bar and dining area are warm, modern and inviting - about the best thing in this hotel. If you decide to stay here, I suggest you get a room on the highest floor possible and TAKE EARPLUGS!

Reviews.Title: “Best Service in Sydney!!”
Reviews.Author: JohnTelmer
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel are the most enthusiastic and friendly I have ever encountered! Well done to the management at the hotel, having stayed in the Perth equivelant I have an opposite impression. Great job!!

Reviews.Title: “Location Central Excellent. Fantastic Room. Clean Crisp Top Service. Highly Recommend.”
Reviews.Author: vivvy6022
Reviews.Content: A Great Stay. Central to everything in Sydney. Easy, no Fuss. Extremely Hospitable Accommodation. Will come back. Rivals many places l have stayed at. My hat off to all the staff at The Marque, Sydney. AAAAAA+++++++.

Reviews.Title: “a lifetime experience”
Reviews.Author: 180479alison
Reviews.Content: A holiday that myself and my husband dreamed off only to be shattered by my husband becoming very poorly,not by any fault of the hotel i must stress.Being what felt like alone on the other side of the world the staff at this hotel helped me and my husband live that dream.I especially want to mention Todd look out for this man he is a exception and i owe him a massive thank you for all the help he did for us,words can not thank him enough.Within a hour of Todd calling a doctor my husband was back on his feet and we had a amazing time,enjoying all the wounderfull sights of sydney. The service was excepional and the location being right in the centre of town gave us the opportunity to do lots and not have lots of travelling to do. my only one problem was the room location being on a very busy corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, poor hygiene.”
Reviews.Author: neurosis3000
Reviews.Content: We booked the Marque at the last minute because it was the Easter long weekend and other hotels we tried were full. The location was fantastic and it is very easy to access via taxi, bus or train, being right next to Central train station. It is located only a few minutes from Chinatown, Paddy's Market and Darling Harbour which made it very convenient. It is also very close to the 555 bus which provides a free service around the city. When we checked in, we tried to make a cup of tea but found the kettle in the room to be filthy. There was some kind of brown, gooey muck coating the inside. We asked for another one which was promptly provided by housekeeping. Our friend in a different room found the same. Furthermore, our friend discovered that all the power points in her room were not functioning. The staff were friendly and helpful enough. New kettles were promptly delivered. Once notified, the power problem was resolved during the day when we were out. However, perhaps they could have offered to move her to another room instead of waiting till morning to have the problem fixed. They also assisted in breaking a luggage lock that was stuck on one of our bags, The rooms themselves were standard 3-star quality. No surprises there. However, due to the narrow building, all our rooms were affected by the loud beeping chimes of the elevator. This was worst in the evenings and mornings when people were arriving and departing.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chattis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marque for 5 nights, was attending a wedding in Sydney plus sightseeing. Was very impressed with this hotel, it was very central to all things in Sydney but particularly Central Station, Paddy's Market and China Town. The staff were incredible, could not do more for you, were extremely friendly, helpful and courteous. The rooms were well appointed and spotlessly clean, ours was at the back of the hotel and did not have a view but was very quiet, other family were looking towards Central Station and found it a little noisy, but given that it overlooks a major intersection you can understand why. Would happily stay here again and do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: karlpestell
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Marque in mid November 2010. We had a lovely corner room which was fairly big and very clean/tidy. The staff were really friendly and always willing to help with directions etc. This hotel is located either in or very close to "China Town" and therefore there are lots of chinese food places around, a very good atmosphere, it must be said. The location of the hotel is about a 30 minute walk to the Harbour Bridge/Opera house but on the metro its about a 5 minute ride. If we were to come back to Sydney again, I'd definately think about staying here again. Thanks for a great 4 night stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay in Marque hotel.”
Reviews.Author: olyabs
Reviews.Content: Well we had really bad experience in Marque Hotel . We booked hotel from 3 Feb until 12 Feb . On the 4th of February we left our room around 10 am and 100% looked the room as we both checked twice on our return at 7 pm the door wasnâ€™t opening so we got a new key. When we opened the door we noticed laptop was missing and our passports was on the floor. As hotel rooms donâ€™t have safe, we put all the value things in secure suit case and suit case was broken into as well. Jewellery was missing , video camera with all our sons videos on it, cash . Cut the story short, not a good experience they are saying they 4 star hotel but experience we had was only for 1 star. Staff was very shocked but not helpful at all ..Duty manager was trying to escape us all the rest of the week and at the end we didnâ€™t get any answers. We did stay in the hotel until the end of our trip as most of hotels was booked out as it was Chinese New Year. Thanks god we had travel insurance, but still very unpleasant experience. They donâ€™t have cameras on the floor or in elevator ,only at reception. We wouldnâ€™t recommended staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again if i go back to Sydney”
Reviews.Author: pampiay
Reviews.Content: Stay was not really pleasant. The only plus point was the location, but still a bit far to walk to darling habour. And also had 3 hrs free internet . Booked 3 executive twin rooms, but was given 3 double rooms which caused on some inconvenience. The hotel blamed it on the online portal that I booked the hotel from, saying that they did not receive our request. Requested for just 1 twin, but was not possible as rooms were full. The staff at first told us to come back first thing the next morning to check and request again(why can't they just keep a note?). When we spoke to another staff, the other staff told us that the rooms are full to the weekend and surely will not be able to change our rooms. The earlier staff could have told us. Service was not good for the price we paid. Poor value for money. Although rooms are newly furbished, carpet had stains, paint job was not good. The shower had no door and therefore the whole toilet floor was wet. Kettle was black in the inside, when requested for another kettle, it was also black in the insde when we used our toothbrush too test. Burnt side table, remote control was not working for another room. Will not go back there again for the amount we paid, not sure if the time we stayed was a peak period(Tues to Friday - no weekends).

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: Alansouthampton
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel nice large rooms, very comfortable, freindly staff very helpful, the only proble was the internet was by data cable and you can only have one connection not good if you have 2 laptops. other than that no problems at all, the hotel is right on the main drag (george St) nice walk to the sydney habour bridge and the opera house, tkae a city tour 35 dollers each 2 routes, good meals out a bit expensive but your on holiday

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly & helpful staff, clean & comfy rooms.”
Reviews.Author: UmpireSupreme
Reviews.Content: Daughter & I visited Sydney 2 Feb to 7 Feb, and this hotel was perfect for us. Location superb with the Central Station just across road, pool a real bonus during the hottest heatwave in 100 odd years! The staff were so helpful & friendly, making us both feel welcome. With comfy beds and minimal noise we slept like logs in our 9th floor room. Even the few homeless people outside were nice. Yes they do exist but guess what, if you treat them as humans they react accordingly! Thanks to all at the Marque we had a great time - your suggestions for nightlife & restaurants were spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Linnilon
Reviews.Content: Good location near to all trains, underground, trams etc and within walking distance of many attractions and areas. Rooms were newly refurbed with nice toiletries, towels and kinens. It was a bit noisy as it's on a busy corner but although I'm a light sleeper it didn't cause me any problem. I'd stay here again if I wanted value for money and I was plannng on being out and about for the majority of the time. It fitted the bill perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “No frills comfortable clean room, little bit of noise”
Reviews.Author: TassieHappyTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nites at Marque. The rooms were nicely decorated and very clean. There was a bit of wear and tear in bedroom but bathroom was spotless. The traffic noise is definitely audible however, my husband and I are both light sleepers and still didn't have any worries sleeping. Its more a continuous hum rather than stop and start noise - I didn't even use my ear plugs! The pool was good for cooling down after a hot day sight seeing. Perhaps having towels up there would be a good idea rather than having to ask reception all the time? The location is good with the free shuttle bus stopping very nearby. Head thru the train station and up to Surrey Hills (Crown st) about 10 mins for some great eating! Overall it was a pleasant stay for the price ($AU131). We also didn't find the homeless an issue as there was only 1-2 and they were around the corner (not really the hotel's fault anyway).

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, none too clean, service zero.”
Reviews.Author: tartanmbird
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 days from 12/24 thru 1/2/11. On the high holiday nights ($515 per night for a small room) we did not have our room cleaned, did not have our beds made up, did not have our waste bins emptied. they basically just left a note in the rooms explaining that all they would do on these nights would be empty trash and replace bath linen. Neither were done and we arrived home to unmade beds. Rather steep prices for zero service. The surrounding neighborhood is scruffy and our room was scruffier. The spare blanket was grubby and the lack of baseboards in the room and the cheap carpet made us feel as if we were staying in a cheap motel. However we have never stayed at a motel in the US where the service was non-existent, as here. We hated it and would have moved had we not been there for the peak period to attend a wedding. Don't stay here - depressing place with apathetic staff who are rarely in evidence at the front desk and a dingy laundry room with stained iron that hasn't been cleaned in ages..

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Punka_3
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel. The room comes equipped with all facilities including an iPod dock, and 3 hours free Internet per day. The only thing missing was breakfast! Lovely and modern, clean and spacious room and friendly staff. I'd definitely recommend this hotel to others. We even had five nights for the price of four over Xmas.

Reviews.Title: “Homeless people living outside and very noisy”
Reviews.Author: JessicaBerry
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 nights stay at The Marque Sydney. Firstly the badâ€¦ Homeless people seemed to be living permanently at the side of the hotel reception (see photo). When you left or returned to the hotel if you walked passed them they would be sat drinking, swearing, begging and harassing people passing by. Also if you cut through the small park to central train station there was also drunk homeless people sat along the path, so we only used this short cut in the daytime and in the evenings walked the long way round to the hotel. The rooms on the front of the hotel are extremely noisy despite us being on the 11th floor and the rooms having secondary glazing. When we booked in July for a December stay in the comments section I added â€˜prefer room away from lift in a quiet part of the hotel if possible. Thank youâ€™, we go to check in and are given a room right outside the lifts and on the front of the hotel on the busiest section of a major road junction. We went to reception to see about changing rooms but were told the hotel was fully booked and to ask the following morning. We had paid extra to upgrade to an Executive Room which was described on the hotel booking reservation (we booked directly with the hotel) as â€˜offering a quiet sanctuary away from the busy cosmopolitan cityâ€™. All night all we could hear was cars, buses and trucks, the traffic noise was loud all night. When we went to the reception the next morning, I pointed out our request that we made back in July and also the description the hotel has about offering a â€˜quiet sanctuaryâ€™. The receptionist said that basically they did not take much notice of requests (I think they had totally ignored ours) and peoples interpretation of â€˜quietâ€™ depends on what they are used to. I would argue that unless you live on a major road junction (see photo) in a main city, no one would call this a â€˜quiet sanctuaryâ€™. We were moved to a room on the side of the hotel, which was quieter but I would still not call it a â€˜quiet sanctuaryâ€™. I think someone in the Marketing Department who has never slept at this hotel has been very creative!! Now the goodâ€¦ Convenient location close to central train station, so makes it easy to use public transport to get around Sydney. We did not hear any noise from the other rooms. Overall we would not stay at this hotel again. We chose the hotel as we were going to see Bon Jovi in concert and we worked out it was in a convenient location to get to the concert. When we visit Sydney again we will stay in The Rocks or Darling Harbour area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent price”
Reviews.Author: crazy4travelgirl
Reviews.Content: The best aspect of this hotel is the location, very close to central railway station and only a few blocks from a monorail station as well. We got a pretty good deal by booking ahead online, so at the discounted price I think it was good value for money. We did notice a bit of trafic noise, eventhough we were on the 11th floor, however it didn't impact on our sleep and in fact the bed was the most comfortable I think I've ever had in a hotel! Breakfast could do with a few extras as it was very basic, however what was there was yummy and plentiful. Overall I'd definitely stay there again as it's so central and with discounts, you can get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely noisy”
Reviews.Author: aitenshi
Reviews.Content: As we entered the room my first impression was that it looked reasonably clean. I walked over to the bed and took off the bed cover and pulled back the sheets to check it. Upon closer inspection of the bed linen I found that it had a lot of hair probably from previous guests. Bath towels looked clean, however, when I used the hand towels I found lots of dark brown hair on them (not mine or my partner's as our hair colour is different). Upon check in I requested a room at the back of the hotel as I had read reviews stating that this hotel is extremely noisy. It didn't matter that we were at the back of the hotel the traffic noise was continous. Even with earplugs on it was very difficult to sleep as it was really noisy throughout the night from the traffic and other guests talking or running up and down the hallway. We deliberately placed rubbish in different areas of the room to see if house keeping would notice and clean it but it wasn't. We also found that despite the fact we requested bed linen to be changed it was not. Bed was merely done up with the same sheets. Overall, we did not get any sleep during our 3nights stay at this hotel. However, location of this hotel is good, as it is directly opposite central station and only a stone's throw away from Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Its OK..”
Reviews.Author: proud2bkiwi
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I stayed here for 5 nights â€“ my impression online was a very nice 4 star accommodation but I disagree â€“ would rate this a 3 star â€“ room facilities were OK (to be honest Iâ€™ve stayed 3 star hotels with nicer rooms), staff were friendly. Great location, directly opposite central station which was convenient. Roof pool ok, good view. Overall OK, I guess I had a higher expectation due to the hotel rating and the Marque property in CHC being so fab. Iâ€™m glad I got a deal through airNZ holidays as I think I would have been disappointed if I had to pay the going rate at the time (AU155). I would stay again.. but if I got a deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, prime location”
Reviews.Author: Aspirin10
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at this hotel, i stayed 6 nights. I booked via wotif and got a great rate. what i like most: nice rooms, (dont be fooled by the tired exterior of the hotel, inside it's been refurbished and is modern and nice). prime location, right outside Central train station, walk to city, haymarket (chinatown), Broadway and Sydney uni. I had to attend a course at the SydUni and I enjoyed the walk through Victoria gardens every morning to get there. Other perks- free local phone calls, and 3 hours free BB internet each day. (however in room only Ethernet access, no wifi) I would've liked wifi in rooms as well, because i did not have ethernet port on my laptop, so couldnt use free internet in my room. But wifi is available in the hotel foyer on ground floor. Another perk- rooftop pool and lounge chairs for me to have a swim and sun myself in privacy :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice inexpensive choice in the CBD”
Reviews.Author: gypsygirl_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at marque for the 1st time on a business trip. My first tip is the hotel and carpark is hard to find so try coming up Quay st (off sussex st) rather than George st. Check in was great. Quick, efficient and friendly. The rooms are stylish,modern, small but well appointed with comfy bed, plasma, air-con, mini bar. The bathroon had a 'rain-shower' a personal favourite with me! There is also complimentary 3 hours free internet from the rooms, a very rare and wonderful service. A short walk from hotel there is paddy's markets, lots of asian resturants and a shopping centre. The train station is also across the road. Carparking available but expensive at $35 per day but this is a very standard price for Sydney CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: XR6girl
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for four nights and found The Marque a pleasant place to stay. We did not find noise a problem though we requested a quieter room. The room was clean and modern. Would have prefered a kitchenette though to make tea/coffee. A jug and fridge in a cupboard was what we had to use. The lifts were fast. Room was serviced each day except Sunday (resturant closed too). We had two evening meals at the hotel which were very nice. Service a bit slow at times but not a problem. The best vege burger I have tasted. The breakfast seemed popular though we chose to eat elsewhere. The staff were always helpful and friendly. The hotel is situated about 5mins walk from central station which is handy for travel to/from airport. The free 3hr internet download speed was slow but adaquate for general surfing

Reviews.Title: “next to Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: malonely
Reviews.Content: On the southern edge of the CBD, opposite Central Station, next to Chinatown and close to Darling Harbour, the Marque is suitable for business or leisure visits. Recently refurbished rooms, a rooftop swimming pool and adequate parking make this a very convenient hotel spoilt only by traffic noise in front rooms

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel except for..........the traffic noise and being locked out!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Shazzles63
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just spent 3 nights in an Executive King on the 7th floor facing Quay Street. I had read some of the internet reviews about noise (inter-connecting doors and the air-conditioning unit noise if you were on the top floor) and the electronic cards not being programmed for the duration of your stay. When booking I requested a room with no interconnecting door or on the top floor. Upon arrival the staff were welcoming and confirmed that my requests had been taken into account and we had been placed in a room in the back corner of the hotel, The only down side was that we would be looking out to a lane way. Paying over $200 per night we requested a room with a view and the on-duty Manager straight away looked to see what he could do. Our room was exactly as described, with a kIng bed and was lovely and clean. The downside came when it was time to sleep that night - the noise that was heard from the traffic was so loud, just like drag-car racing on your TV and the cop shows when you hear the car noise and the sirens together. This proceeded well into the early hours of the morning. I am a light-medium sleeper and I had to resort to ear plugs whereas my husband normally doesn't hear anything and he woke 3/4 times during the night. Our room appeared to have a form of a noise barrier, with two separate lots of windows and a couple of inches between but they were absolutely ineffective. The noise absolutely spoilt a wonderful hotel, in a great location and friendly staff. I had also enquired on checking in that the programming for our card would be for the duration of our stay and was assured that it would be however, on our last night the cards mysteriously stopped working - they had been fine in the morning and not working in the afternoon. The receptionist stated that this happens when the cards had been placed next to another card or a mobile. My husband kept his in his wallet and I kept mine in the side pocket of my handbag - not close to any mobile or other magnetic field, yet mysteriously they both stopped working at the same time!!!! Somehow I think it was more likely the hotel's computer system causing the problem and not the guests usage!

Reviews.Title: “The Marque Hotel: Definitely on the mark”
Reviews.Author: Aloushka
Reviews.Content: What a hidden gem this hotel is!!! Don't let it's external facade put you off. This hotel is located on the corner of George Street and Quay Street in the city. The hotel is also opposite Central Railway Station (a five minute walk) and there is a bus stop right outside the front door, with buses arriving every minute or two to take you uptown. On arrival I was greeted with efficiency and friendliness by staff and my room was quiet (on the sixth floor) and immaculately clean, including the bathroom areas.
