The price for a three night stay was very reasonably priced and I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again in the future and can highly recommend it!!!! Aloushka, Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel suited us for its location but with some downsides and had nice modern rooms and very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: dougalfreebee
Reviews.Content: This is a modest but nicely modern hotel located on one of Sydneys most busiest intersections so some traffic noise is to be expected. Its location near Central Station was ideal for us and although there is a subway from the station with access near the hotel we chose to use the well worn path across the intersection. The rooms were clean and modern with walk in shower and other amenities you would expect these days such as LCD TV and air conditioning. Bed was comfortable but why is it most hotels provide flat hard pillows? We had a room on the top floor which unfortunately was below the air conditioning units on the roof which provided a constant humming noise throughout the night. We had an early night the first night due to jet lag but could not sleep with the constant background noise. We asked to change rooms the next morning which was no problem. There is also a building site nearby whith the usual construction noises during the day. There are cafes next door and an ATM and a number of Thai or similar restaurants close by but within walking distance is the City Markets with food court and shopping. And don't forget the free shuttle bus running between Central Station and Circular Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely decor, ask for a high floor room”
Reviews.Author: MadeInOz
Reviews.Content: Very central and easy to find, particularly if you are using public transport. Easy walking distance to Chinatown and city shops. Dont forget the Chinatown markets on Friday night, great food. The room was a good size, didnt feel compact at all. Really lovely decor and everything looked new and clean. Lovely bathroom, very modern and clean. Limited toiletries but I guess you can always BYO. The staff in both the restaurant and the reception area were really friendly and upbeat. Couldnt fault the staff, the property or the room. The only thing I would suggest is if you are a light sleeper ask for a room on a high floor. I was on the 9th floor and I slept fine although you could hear background traffic noise but it was certainly not bothersome enough to be a concern. I would recommend this hotel for great value for money and location, lovely clean facilities. Really nice property.

Reviews.Title: “not good”
Reviews.Author: MatUKLondon
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through internet as it is accross the street from Central railway station, but beware, George Street by Central is full of homeless people, beggers and pimps. I had high expectations as the website was well appointed and pictures made me think it is a good hotel. Mistake. First, when booking it, I was on hold for 15 minutes before I actually got through a human being, only to be told the system is down and they do not take any bookings. A what? I am a hotel professional and it was absolutely diabolical! Finally, I booked via website on a special winter saver rate for one night, travelling into Sydney and then two nights when leaving Australia. It seems like customer service there is non existing! You come in, your presence is not acknowledged, guest name mentioned once or even not that, no information about the facilities offered whatsoever. At times reception is left unattended, no staff at the bar, some newspapers on the lobby carpet. Anyone can walk in and blow the place up. Room doors look seriously cheap as you could certainly get in by kicing them. Thin walls, you hear people next to you, noise from the street and a strange panel on the wall beneath the window when the air comes in. I have noticed some areas where dusty, there was hair on the sheets, and some linen dirty. The bathroom drawer is literally filthy (and they keep towels there) with the sink sitting off the wall. Some leakage underneath the drains and on tiles. No shower gel but just a soap, no safe in the room. Some tv channels or bulbs don't work. The pool was closed on the day I stayed. On checking out, at 9h50, there were some guests at reception which staff do not acknowledge at all. You stand there like a jerk, if you don't say a word, no one will help you. The desk was messy and filthy, God knows if anyone wipes it, especially beneath till 1. Staff unattentive, one guy (M) was chewing a gum while at the desk and the girl (V, her initial, did not use proper grammar) was of no help. I was made to leave the bag by a glass wall storage room, but i did not trust them. Anyone can pick up anyone's luggage and leave. Just amazed and disappointed the hotel is rated 4 star (would take all the stars out), all in all, it was not expensive (120 AUD a night), and the location (Central station on doorstep, Chinatown, Paddy's market and Darling Bay within a walking distance) very convenient if you only sleep there. I am not sure if i stay at the Marque again.

Reviews.Title: “A pass, didn't live up to expectations, but did the job. Noisy.”
Reviews.Author: TimeTraveller89
Reviews.Content: Prime location travel wise, being opposite central station and although it's not their fault of the busy traffic below, even at night, something should have been done to sound proof the rooms. Staff were very friendly and useful. Didn't experience room service, but it wasn't the cleanest room from its last service. Bed was comfortable, flat screen tv was average, bare minimum cable channels and there's no in-room movies like advertised. Continental breakfast was just a pass but again staff were friendly and useful. Shower was excellent and room was a nice temperature. Swimming pool, though small, might be useful for summer, however not sure if the stairwell is the safest entrance point. Corridors were bare, dank and poorly lit. They offer free bag storage if you need it after you checkout, which was very useful. Recommend only if you need a hotel for sleep and as a check in station, which is fine for a busy tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Somebody teach the staff customer service!”
Reviews.Author: thegrumpys
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Sydney so we wanted somewhere near Central Station as we had a few trips in mind during our stay there. The location of the hotel was good, rooms were large and facilities fine and we enjoyed the rooftop pool. The downer was the staff, who with the exception of one concierge on the day we were leaving seemed absolutely terrified of the simplest question. They couldn't or wouldn't provide directions to places of interest and when our room key wouldn't let us in they claimed it was becuse we'd only booked for one night when we'd booked and paid for five. Upon finding this out the receptionsit then claimed that the key had been deactivted because it was in the same pocket as my mobile phone (err...right!). The hotel bar and restaurant closed around 8.30pm each evening. This wasn't a problem as there are numerous brilliant bars and restaurants within easy walking distance. We absolutely loved Sydney and look forward to going back, but suffice to say that it won't be at The Marque.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: stvsun
Reviews.Content: My wife and I sepnt 10 days at Sydney. On day 2, my wife started to have bug bite marks and felt very irritating. Since the situation had gone wrose, we therefore spent one afternoon to see a doctor. The doctor told us that the marks and swelling are caused by bed bugs. I am very angry about what happened and I told the front desk staff, who arrange another room for us. However, until now they did not even apologyize to us and their attitudes are quite hard to believe. This hotel has completely ruin my vacation and I am an idiot if I book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't come here expecting a good night's sleep!”
Reviews.Author: bimdonesia
Reviews.Content: I previously reviewed this hotel favorably, however I must change this. We stayed at the marque again this July, in the same room category as before. We were given a room on the sixth floor. As we entered, I immediately noticed it was a connecting room. How I wish I had followed my instincts and asked to be moved! Alas, we were hungry and could only think of getting some lunch from the great Thai restaurant around the corner. To cut to the chase, the connecting door proved a huge impediment to a good night's sleep. The guests next door were watching tv and listening to music (there is an iPod dock) fairly loudly, and we could hear every single word and note that was said/sung! When you opened the connecting door (their door was locked) the sinus was even louder. There was no way we would be getting any sleep if this continued. So, we called reception. The night manager to whom we spoke was unhelpful. He said we should wait and see if they went to bed soon, and if they didn't, he would call them to inform them of noise complaints. Is this a 4 star hotel? Am I paying AU$180 per night to get no sleep? I can do that In a hostel. So we called back 15mins later, and the battle fir service began. We asked to be moved. He replied, hotel was at capacity, we would just have to wait for them to be quiet. Surely not even one other room is available, we asked. To and fro like this. After many calls it was established that some pre-paid guests had not shown up (by this stage it was about 2330). My partner by thus stage was most frustrated and took the phone. He calmly but directly demanded something be done. Could it be that an authoritative, masculine voice got some action? (I am female) lo and behold, a room materialised on the 4th floor. Here is the clincher- when my partner went downstairs to collect the new keys (yes, that is rift, we even had do do that ourselves), he found out that the night manager had not even called the guests next door yet- this could perhaps have solved all the problems. But I think this man was just too lazy and hoped we would give up. Originally a buffet breakfast was to be our "compensation" but once a room was found, that offer was quickly withdrawn. I have come to expect mediocre service in Australian hotels, but this experience was truly awful. We left feeling exhausted and regretting spending money there. I come to Sydney a few times a year, and after this experience the marque is definitely on my no-go list. A good hotel is one that seeks to help guests and resolve issues quickly and politely, and the marque certainly doesn't fit this description.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory for business travel”
Reviews.Author: SopranosMidlands
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marque from 17th July to 24th. I think I probably expected more 'bells and whistles' from the descrition on the website than you actually get. My colleagues and I all got 'remarqueable rooms' which were in effect suites, so plenty of room ( apart from a bizarrely small amount of hanging space in the wardrobe - ladies beware !!) We only are breakfast there which was very good. Found staff to be reasonably helpful but no porter service so if travelling alone with a number of bags, it might be tricky. Reasonable location although I would recommend staying near the Rocks if your trip is reasonably short. Perfectly adequate but never going to set the world alight....

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers level of competency”
Reviews.Author: Ohrabbitoh
Reviews.Content: Pros: A clean, comfortable room in a central location. A nice roof deck. Cons: Things that are supposed to work (e.g. internet) don't. The hotel advertises "wi-fi" service. However, the internet is available only through a wired connection. In the first room we were assigned, the wire didn't work. We had to wait several hours before the problem was diagnosed and then waited again to be assigned a new room. After a 20 hour flight from the US, this was taxing. Very few electronic devices in the room (e.g, the I-pod docking station) were functional. Other hotel guests seemed to have similar complaints. The staff,while friendly, was not always competent to handle very basic requests.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Bit Noisy”
Reviews.Author: 2socks
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! Walk to the train station via underground walkway, Chinatown and Paddy's Market round the corner, free bus to north CBD up the road, 10-15mins walk to Darling Harbour. Very good location if you're after the southern part of the CBD. For all others, there are the trains and (free) buses. Lobby - The lobby doesn't look like a hotel - looks more like a service apartment so don't expect bellboys and concierge. Lobby is spacious and clean, so is the room (got a special king bed deal with breakfast included). Got a friend who stayed over after a late night out and she loved it. Room - Huge king bed enough for 3 slim adults, big flat screen TV, nice, clean bathroom/shower (no bath though) and moderate storage space. The bed is extremely comfortable; it's a room you want to stay in (if you don't mine the traffic noise). Tea-making facilities - There is no light at the tea making cupboard which makes it a bit of a hassle. The fridge was also stocked with many items - only minimal space for guests own items. Breakfast - Breakfast was good - basic continental breakfast e.g. cereals, bread, eggs, bacon, sausages, fruits, muffins etc. It can get a bit boring after 5 days though. Parking is horribly expensive at A$35/night. And despite requests for a quiet room, was given a room facing the traffic - it's never quiet even at night, even on 11th floor! Service - Some staff could do better with customer service - I arrived early and requested for early check-in if available. I was told to wait till 2pm but after an hour or 2 waiting, saw a group arriving and were immediately given a room even though it's not yet 2pm. I had to then go up and ask for my room, which was then given. House-keeping - service was very good, staff are friendly. Tip: Travelling to the airport - take the shuttle - it's only A$14, cheaper than the train.

Reviews.Title: “Room okay, staff excellent, management terrible”
Reviews.Author: btboz
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and easy. The room itself is quite comfortable. There was a bit of noise from the window (6th floor, overlooking a side street), but nothing unbearable). Convenient location being right across from Central Station - means you can get anywhere easily. Biggest complaint is a story... I went to the in-house restaurant for dinner (so it would go on company tab) only to wait 10 minutes to be seated before I left as it didn't look like I would be served anytime soon. There were only 5 tables currently seated, and it looks like they would cater to about 20 tables in total, so not sure what the problem here was. Decided to try room service only to be told it will be at least 1-1.5 hours before food would arrive. I actually caught up with the waiter in the lift and he indicated he was the only person on, and that was the hold up. He was run off his feet, and indicated that this was not 'normal' but not 'unusual'. For a hotel that really features/publicises it's restaurant it is not a good experience at all. Management should have had the foresight to manage this situation, or at least have processes in place to ensure that someone else could help out. Chatted to the front desk and they do not have charge-back arrangements with any local restaurants (a simple mitigation to the lack of waiters in the restaurant). I should also mention that the front desk staff member took another 10 minutes to even start to help me as he was the only person on the desk and was on the phone, therefore unable to help me (again - why only one if they may spend that amount of time on the phone???). As a business traveller, the simple things like easy food arrangements and efficient service etc. are important, and for this reason I found the stay at the Marque very substandard.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely convenient to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Squid24
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, we stayed 8 nights and had no problems. I booked the hotel for the location, close to Central station, Paddy's Market and Darling Habour. I didn't realise that there was a bus terminal at the door, we found it so easy to get around, if we missed one bus there was another 5 minutes later! We used the airport train to get to and from the hotel and it was a very easy walk with our suitcases When we checked in we were given a room on the 12th floor, once we got there it was twin beds, we had booked a king. We went straight back down and were given another room on the 4th floor, the bed was twin singles zipped together, but hubby thinks it's the most comfortable hotel bed his ever slept in - even suggested we bring it home. I am a light sleeper so was a little concern about the noise mention in previous reviews, but I had no problems except for the 2nd last night when the tiles were being replaced on the foot path and they had a jack hammer going at 1am, but I went straight back off to sleep so it can't have gone to long. There are no cleaning staff on Sundays which hubby thought was strange(he works in the hotel industry) We didn't eat at the hotel, but the food sounded good on the menu and the resturant always seemed busy. We did have dinner at the pub across the road one night and that was lovely and cheap. We used the pool twice and liked it, nice beng able to come back on a hot afternoon(it was 37 one day) for a refreshing dip before going out for dinner. We really only seen the reception staff and they were very friendly. I couldn't find any photo's of the bathrooms when we were booking so I did take some to add, it's small but had everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Hazard”
Reviews.Author: cardboard_robot
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights ahile ago. I was given 1st floor room that has a small balcony/courtyard. First thing I did was walk out onto the balcony and slip down the stairs. There was a massive amount of water all over the stairs dripping from the air conditioners from all the rooms above. Needless to say i was in terrible pain. When a staff member came after my partner called reception they just looked at the water puddle and advised us not to go outside! I would never stay here again and never recommed this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way, will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: galaga_girl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right across the road from Central Station and only a 3 - 5 min very easy short walk to Darling Harbour and Haymarket. We didn't have to get public transport to any part of the city from this hotel as everything we wanted to see and do was within walking distance. The hotel itself was great, everything was very clean we didn't have a view as our room faced another hotel but I think if we did have a view room it would have been of the VERY busy streets below and probably would have been noisy so we were glad we had one on the "bad" side of the building. I would definetly stay here again, we got a great rate as it was only $89 a night over a long weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, noice only down side”
Reviews.Author: ErnoP
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right next to Central station, in retrospective should have taken a taxi from the airport as train tickets for two persons were more expensive. You can walk easily from hotel to CBD Sydney. Staff was full of young energy and definately one of the best qualities of this hotel. Pool at the roof looks nice in pictures, unfortunately didn't have time to test it. Breakfast in the restaurant is recommendable and reasonably priced. There's a lot of traffic going by so that it will be noicy probably all the time in this hotel. Price level is fine and cleanliness and other necessities are at acceptable level at the Marque.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: sofke8868
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in this hotel, just one day before a long flight to Bangkok. When I checked in, I first had a room on the 9th floor facing Railway Square. - probably one of the busiest spots in Sydney. I had considered the busy traffic before booking the hotel, but I thought a quality hotel like this must have a good isolation. The 9th floor room was too noisy for me, so I asked reception if they could give me another room. The staff was so kind to change me and found a quieter room on the backside of the hotel. It was still noisy though but I managed to sleep (with ear plugs). The room was very nice and clean, with many luxuries (even an ipod docking station). Tip: the restaurant in the hotel serves very nice Wagyu meat (it's expensive though :-)

Reviews.Title: “Ignore negative reviews! Couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: Chanez84
Reviews.Content: My stay at Marque, despite the previous negative reviews, was absolutely fantastic! Being an 8 min walk from Darling Harbour and a 15min train ride to Bondi Beach you can't go wrong! The staff were more than heplful and went over and above their required duties to make sure that a young woman staying on my own was very well looked after. Not only were the reception staff amazing, so were the restaurant staff. The rooms were great! Incredibly clean and comfortable and the rooftop pool was a wonderful, private area to read a book and enjoy a glass of wine! I was a solo traveler looking for a few days of relaxation and discovery before the Christmas rush and I definately found it!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not spectacular”
Reviews.Author: dr_rob80
Reviews.Content: Booked through an internet booking site, I got a good rate. On reflection, the rate was probably not as good as I thought in terms of the room and the hotel. The room itself was quite sizeable and relatively well appointed. A proper king size bed, not just two singles pushed together, decent TV, mini-bar, iron and ironing board (helpful for the business traveller who needs to iron in the morning). Bathroom was ok, but the lack of door to the shower meant water did get out and everywhere on the floor. Water pressure in the sink was a bit weak as well. Room service was very limited in menu, and also only operating between 5:30 and 10:30pm. Internet was cripplingly expensive, but there is a dirt cheap internet cafe two doors down. My real issue, as with others, came at breakfast. A full breakfast was $22. For that price, I expect a decent spread of food. What i got was a quite limited selection. Only one serving of eggs was allowed, made fresh in the Kitchen (a point there I suppose, but if you wanted more eggs...tough). Limited selection of hot foods, limited choice of bread (white or wholegrain), only a couple of types of cereal, and a pathetically small pastry selection. Most disappointingly was the limit of one cup of tea/coffee per person. Breakfast was over by 9am, which didnt bother me much as a business traveller, but I saw a few leisure tourists, including those in town for the Masters Games a bit befuddled by being told no more breakfast at 9:15am. Good points: location was good, close to central station. Room was quite clean and the bed was comfortable, though the pillows were a bit thin. Bad points: Facing the road was a bit noisy. The Ipod docking station backlighting made the room quite bright when I was trying to sleep. That might sound a bit strange, but it really was very bright. I ended up unplugging it. All up, I found it to be little better than most motels Ive stayed in, and certainly not the value pick I thought it was. Recommended only on the proviso of a short overnight stay and a low level of needs and wants.

Reviews.Title: “The Marque doesn't hit the mark.”
Reviews.Author: web-couple
Reviews.Content: We stayed recently for three nights, the hotel has recently been renovated and the rooms are of a good size, decor is fresh, but the location on one of Sydney's bussiest junctions makes for lots of traffic noise. We lasted one night in our front room and asked to be moved to a quiet room, this was done, we only had to forfiet our view which was no problem as there was so much grim on the outside of the windows it was difficult to see anyway. The hotel stops serving breakfast at 9am promt, the buffet is cleared away wether your finished or not and the rude oriental waitress makes it very clear you need to come early if want breakfast. The 'can do attitude' evapotates when you complain at reception, so beware. I would only use this hotel as an overnight stop if passing through as it does not cater for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms all new, pool beautiful, outside terrible and noise is disturbing”
Reviews.Author: annemariejl
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been refurbished and the rooms are very nice. it is good value but and the but is huge. all the rooms and we had 2 different rooms we were on the 09th floor and at night it felt that our bed was outside on the street it was so noisy therefore not the best hotel that one could pick. When this was said to the staff they shrugged. I think that says it all for me.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfy city location with excellent access to all city and country trains.”
Reviews.Author: Varietal
Reviews.Content: We chose the Marque for its proximity to Central Station as we were on the trains in all directions throughout our stay. Despite being opposite Central, we did WALK to Circular Quay quite comfortably. Chinatown and Darling Harbour are even closer. Our room on the 10th floor was modern, spacious, and very comfortable - especially the King Size bed! The view was magnificent, but not nearly as fabulous as the panorama available on the 12th floor pool deck! The double set of sliding windows was quite effective in keeping out the city noises (as we discovered after having left one partly open on the first night!). The restaurant and foyer have a pleasant ambience. Only one breakfast in the restaurant, but it was good. The foyer has an adjacent semi-private and quiet lounge area which we used with a bunch of relatives and were able to access the restaurant's bar service. Every staff member encountered was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “average value - but beware the noise”
Reviews.Author: not_yet_world_weary
Reviews.Content: We have just completed a stay of five days at the Marque Hotel Sydney. Room charges for two adults and one young teenager were around $200 per night (via the entertainment card) for a large well furnished room with a great kingbed and a foldout sofabed. This would have been reasonable value if it had facilites as advertised. All beds very comfortable and furnishings were near new. The room was the "remarquable" class room but is misrepresented on the hotel website where in such a room you are invited to "cook up a storm" if you so wish - difficult with only a sink and an electric jug for preparation. We had planned to prepare some of our own meals to manage the budget so this was a serious dissapointment. The concierge seemed to find the lack of a microwave in the room unremarkable so I guess the website is clearly misleading. These rooms are not suitable if you wish to prepare your own meals or snacks. They do have crockery and cutlery however. Of equal concern was the traffic noise. The hotel location is on the main road into Sydney from the airport and extremely noisy, even on the 10th floor - take earplugs! Staff were friendly enough and the close proximity to Central station makes travel aroud the city very easy. A German bread shop in the station entry area (Railway Square entrance) sells excellent bread and there are many relatively cheap asian food outlets nearby due to this being the centre of the chinese/asian quarter of Sydney. Great fresh fruit and veg available on weekends at the local "Paddy's markets". All in all average value for money but the oversell on the website was a substantial disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Thrilled!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: InvercargillNZ
Reviews.Content: I wanted something clean, modern and central, at a reasonable price. This Hotel is beautifully clean and very nicely modernised. It's right across the road from the Central Station, making transport a breeze. The price was incredibly inexpensive for the quality of the Hotel. The showers are bliss! They even let us check it way before check in time. I'll stay here next time I'm in Sydney! Please check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain luxury in great location”
Reviews.Author: mlperkins
Reviews.Content: Look around to get a good deal. We did!! breakfast not included. Parking nearby, opposite train/bus stops and really near darling harbour, chinatown and russell street fr shopping and eating. The room was small but had a funky design. flat screen tv. Lovely walk in shower, nice freebies!!! the bed was plush and comfy. They delivered a cot on request. We only stayed one night but would've been happt o stay longer if we hadn't had to go back to the snowy UK. Lovely place to stay for our last night of a month away. Oh and the rooftop pool, altough absolutely bloody freexing in the height of their summer, was wicked!!!!!! Decked rooftop area with amaaaazing views of Sydney. Rounded up our trip perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: aj9999
Reviews.Content: I was initially nervous about this hotel as we bought it as part of a cheap Virgin Blue package but I was wrong! The whole experience was fantastic. Great location by Central Station and within walking distance to Circular Quay, The Rocks and Oxford Street. We had a large (in hotel standards), recently renovated room with a King size bed. Hotel has a roof top terrace with pool and sauna. We didnt eat in the hotel at all but menu looked ok despite it being on the pricey side. Friendly front desk staff who helped us out a few times. Definately one of the better places I have stayed in Sydney. Thoroughly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Shop around and get a bargain”
Reviews.Author: icemagic
Reviews.Content: I shopped around online and then rang the hotel which meant $100 for a twin room per night - thatâ€™s a bargain in my books. I stayed here with a friend one night after work to be close to central (right across the road) early the next morning and found the room to be basically brand new - according to the booking guy ALL of the rooms have now been renovated. I was also worried about the noise being so central, but our room wasn't on the street side and it was fine apart from perhaps the standard hotel thin walls- but then again we got in late from the many bars and clubs and then were out early. This was cheaper than staying at the YHA for two singles and the rain shower was heavenly and in our room!

Reviews.Title: “Very good location , clean and well maintained”
Reviews.Author: Bepsi
Reviews.Content: It was the first time that we had booked a hotel thru' Travelocity , so were a little worried whether it would be as per the description and various other facilities mentioned.Let me tell you that the location is just PERFECT for anyone who has to rely on public transport. Our friends in Sydney were really surprised that we had located this very centrally placed hotel on the internet. Also, we appreciated the fact that they had mentioned that some renovation work would be happening during out stay there and hence some disturbance would be there.Of course it didnt bother us since we were out for the day when that was taking place.The room was very neat and clean and big enough for the three of us. Would recommend it for anyone who wants a hotel centrally located and not very expensive.Good value for money...though the locals told us we could have got something else for a little less ! Viraf Mehta Trip ID: 96520584 JetPrivilege membership: 102293612

Reviews.Title: “great location and good for those on a budget”
Reviews.Author: merlie
Reviews.Content: Great position,spotless,renovated,nice room. Pleasant staff,special thank you to Marco,for arranging our special stay.. Close to transport,and central station. Buses at side of hotel to Circular Quay.Walk to china town Pddys market. Light rail runs from central station,takes you to Exibition centre ,Darling Harbour,Star City. Convience store near hotel,Thai rest across road. Enjoyed stay at Marque Hotel,but was dissapointed with breakfast,this treat was to be highlight of each day,but same food served each day no variety,scrambled eggs okay but not 4 days in row,the bacon was cooked so crisp hard to eat,dissapointing when they charge 22 dollars each,not worth that,compared to other hotels,if not in our package would advise to eat at one of the coffee shops 6.50 for bacon eggs and coffee. Catch the Sydney explorer bus 39.00 but all day pass to sights of Sydney and Bondi,get on off all day and can use ticket on blue buses. Marque hotel is in easy position to get around sydney,staff while pleasant do not go out of way to help,except Marco,who was so helpful and made our special trip to Sydney so great.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Darling Harbour & China Town”
Reviews.Author: NilesPortMacquarie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before but this time found it completely updated and modernised. King Size bed and flat screen TV. Bathroom ultra modern with fantastic shower head, quality fittings. Friendly & efficient staff. very close to Central Station, China Town, Paddy's Market short walk Capitol Theatre. Traffic noise only drawback.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a PRIME location!!”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaLover
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights upon my arrival to Sydney. It is literally right across from Central Station, which makes the incredible transportation service in Sydney even more ideal. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Everything you need is literally right out the front door...convenience stores, great thai food right across the street, internet cafe about six doors down, and once again, transportation right there! Take advantage of this friendly, easy, accommodating hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Sunnilue
Reviews.Content: We were in Sydney for Easter weekend so our options were limited if we were to stay on a budget (Royal Easter Show is in town for Easter). We chose the Marque regardless of the mixed reviews because it was one of the few reasonably priced hotels to choose from. The reviews were dead on though! The room looked like it was out of the 70's, with walls of brick veneer. The beds were horrible, they were soft foam that was so flimsy that they folded up around you if you sat sideways in the middle (like an inflatable raft in water!). They were also very low to the floor so getting up from the beds was a comical disaster! The room wasn't particularly dirty, but it didn't seem clean either. It turns out the hotel is rennovating their rooms and the new rooms are not so bad, but they are the more expensive rooms. We were not disturbed by the construction due to the holiday weekend. The hotel is right across the street from the main train station. This also meant that there were quite a few bums hanging around, though none gave us any trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: australiamel
Reviews.Content: Newly renovated boutique hotel close to Central Station. Still ongoing work while we were around, but you would hardly take notice (and the rates were great!). Everything brandnew and very clean. Great deal if you want to stay right in the city centre!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Room I've Ever Stayed In (and I've stayed in a few)!”
Reviews.Author: Tortoiseface1
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here I was a little worried about getting one of the older rooms. We were on the 7th floor, and the room was gorgeous (which was a good job as it rained the whole time we were there) We had a lovely king size bed, a nice view across the streets, the bedding and bathroom were clean, towels changed, mini bar restocked and bed made everyday, about 12 ish so never got interrupted. Staff at reception were very friendly, and happy to help with any directions we needed and taxis. From the outside it doesn't look great, and I agree with past reviews about the rickety old lifts, but even with these.. I loved our room! Plus not overly expensive

Reviews.Title: “Under Construction”
Reviews.Author: pixie2097
Reviews.Content: We booked the day before and arrived to find the building was being overhauled. Our room thankfully was one of the the very nice newly refurbished rooms several floors from the ongoing work. Insist on a refurbished room if you book, away from the workmen. The lift gives a clue of what the hotel looked like prior to the work and it looks like the place hadn't been updated since the 70's. The location is faultless for a first timer exploring Sydney and the staff were pleasant. As for breakfast, we decided to eat out at one of the cafes round the corner for about half what the hotel wanted.

Reviews.Title: “marque the worst stay in sydney”
Reviews.Author: CHEFASH
Reviews.Content: i stayed for 4 nights it is ment to be 4 star but i would not give it 2 the lifts do not work and i was on the top floor with 2 small kids no staff to help carry bags up all the flights staff are rude no kids meals jack hammer above my head at 630 am no room service on sundays hotel is a mess work mans tools all over the place hot water works some times pay for car park then find my car coverd in concret dust stuck in lift when it did work no hot breakfest buffee the worst stay in hotel i have ever had did not want to pay my bill !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: TheCollies
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel via a secret deal on lastminute.com. Having seen the other reviews I was a little concerned about what we would get but actually we were very happy. We had a room which had recently been renovated and was clean and tastefully decorated. Our deal also included breakfast which we have no complaints about. The staff were very friendly and efficient. I note that a lot of comments here are about the noise as this hotel is close to the train station, however there is very little noise from the trains but a bit from the roads. At the end of the day this is a hotel in the centre of Sydney so I think the noise levels are comparable with any other hotel in the city. They are still renovating the lower floors so during the day there is noise from the works which can be heard throughout the hotel but this is only during sociable hours. We were very happy with our stay, thought it was great value for money and would recommend it to anyone looking for a mid priced hotel in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, central location”
Reviews.Author: happyadventurers
Reviews.Content: I took my son on his first plane trip to Sydney for the weekend and stayed 2 nights at the Marque Hotel. We were pleasantly surprised and enjoyed our stay, even after reading some not so pleasant reviews about the hotel. I booked direct and had an entainment gold card but decided to upgrade to the re-furbished rooms on the upper floors. So pleased I did, as we did get a peak of unfurbished rooms and yes, it was worth the extra $40 per night! We had a lovely clean room with a king size bed, flat screen tv with free movie channels. I have to say the best thing about the room was the shower, it was fantastic. The only negative thing I have to say is that the outside of the building looks very tired and old and has not yet been updated and the windows were very dirty, other than that we enjoyed everything. We did not venture far at night, but there were always lots of people about and everything we needed was nearby. We loved the free internet access on the laptops in the lobby of the hotel, my son was very happy. We found all the staff friendly and helpful, and yes, Marco is a great asset to the hotel. Breakfast was included in our package, but really found it very ordinary. My son enjoyed it though! Overall, we had a wonderful stay and yes, we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Small, smelly and NOT worth the money”
Reviews.Author: screename_schmeename
Reviews.Content: I booked a so-called "Premier King" room for my husband and I for a weekend stay in Sydney. I had an Entertainment Club card, which gave me a 50% discount, though the price was still $175 after discount! At that price, I had reasonable expectations. I was most disappointed. The room we were given was tiny, with no windows. It was a non-smoking room, but definitely smelled of smoke and something else... probably mould considering there were no windows and no exhaust fan in the bathroom. Yes, it had a king size bed and was newly refurbished with flat screen tv, but that's it. It was definitely NOT somewhere we felt comfortable. I was looking forward to having somewhere to chill out after heading out on Saturday night, but I was actually dreading coming back to our tiny stinky room. Also, the undercover parking area is very small and difficult to maneouver in (I'd hate to think what it would have been like for someone with a large vehicle... mine was only medium sized). The staff were friendly enough, but I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: canberra1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marque Hotel for one night booking on Wotif for $99 per night. Stayed in a renovated room with huge king bed, large TV screen and great shower , all very comfortable. They stored my luggage until the room was ready and also on departure. The reception area is new and I found the staff to be fine. The only gripe is the traffic noise as it is right opposite Central Station and I found it noisy at night, next time I would take ear plugs. Location is great, very close to Chinatown and Paddies market. The buses run right outside down to Circular Quay , $1.80 per ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: PurpleGirl1
Reviews.Content: The ground floor renovations were noisy at 7.30am even on the 4th floor. They moved us the next night to the 9th floor - a grotty, shabby room with many, many issues. Honi, guy on reception, was surly, unhelpful and completely ignored our request to move again. Marco, another receptionist we spoke to later, deserves to run the hotel. He was excellent and upgraded us to a renovated room on the 12th floor and apologised profusely on behalf of the hotel. Can't say we were particularly impressed by the renovated rooms, but they are better than the original ones. Overall I wouldn't recommend this hotel. Perhaps when the renovations are complete and its less noisy, but if you see Honi just run.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: limby
Reviews.Content: Booked a twin room on Travelocity for 90 USD. When we got there, we were able to upgrade to a *renovated* queen room for 60 AUD more. (This upgrade rate actually dropped to 40 AUD the next day; shrug.) The renovated room was nice and clean, with the patina of modernity. Not a true built-from-the-ground-up boutique hotel room, but still totally fine, and well worth the 140 USD per night. For us, it was particularly convenient, being located catty-corner to the central station. From the airport, take the train into town, walk out of the train station, and the Marque is across the street. It's also situated close to Chinatown, which was fun for us, and just a fifteen minute walk to the CBD.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: arwon
Reviews.Content: have stayed at the Marque formerly ( country comfort ) on several occasions, and found it both affordable & very easy to trip around Sydney from, being close to central stn, china town, monorail etc was undergoing refurbishments whilst there, which created a bit of a mess in the lifts etc, from tradesmen's rubble, also could have been a little cleaner in bathroom. as I don't think they clean behind the loo or the toilet brush etc, other than that, we would stay again & I look forward to seeing the new updated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very noisy”
Reviews.Author: tabbyEngland
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via the hotel web site for a 4 night stay prior to returning to the UK, there was no mention that the hotel was been renovation or that there would be any noise from building work. We stop in one of the newly renovated rooms on the 12 floor, which was very good, and would have been very happy if it was not for the fact that the builders started work every morning at 9am and finished at 5pm including weekends !! When we phoned reception to ask when it would be finished they suggested that we went for walk...... There is also a lot of noise from the traffic outside, as the hotel in on a main cross roads out of Sydney. Floor 12 is the only floor finish at the moment, and they are currently working on floors 11 & 10.

Reviews.Title: “This is my favorite hotel in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: AndrewAustralian
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Sydney. The bed and breakfast option for around $160 a night is excellent value. I like the rooms next to the lift, in terms of miniming noise. 1101 1001 901 etc. Once I had some trouble with stuff working in the room, but it was fixed real fast. It is near China town which is great. It is also near Central Railway station. You can get a day pass for rail/ferries for around $15. If saying for more than 2 days, look at getting a weekly pass.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Handy”
Reviews.Author: sidneyxx
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the newly renamed Marque Hotel (formerly Country Comfort) for the main reason that it was "cheap and handy". For Sydney accommodation in a good location, my $112 p.n. in a double room was excellent. The room itself was quite comfortable and the bathroom was clean and a good size. It was somewhat dated (they say they are refurbishing the premises now they are under the Marque banner), and being right at Central Station it was noisy. But, as I said above, for the price it was most acceptable. However, my initial goodwill towards the premises became somewhat diminished. I made the mistake of inviting my daughter to join me in the restaurant downstairs for dinner. We waited exactly an hour from the time we ordered our meal until it was served. There was nearly a mini-rebellion in the dining room. There were only about 10 of us altogether, but the waiter said they were very busy that night - hence the delay! Maybe they only had one chef and he was busy doing room service meals. When our meal did arrive, my daugher's meal was not as described on the menu, and the salad had black slimy lettuce leaves in it - and that was nothing to do with dressing, as we had ordered it without dressing. On returning to my room, I discovered the TV remote control didn't work properly, and when I decided to make myself a cup of tea, found the first mug in the cupboard had a crack in the rim, and the second mug had clearly a previous guest's mouth imprint on it. So overall it wasn't a happy experience and I would only ever stay here again if I needed (as I did on this occasion) cheap overnight accommodation due to an early morning appt. next day. Certainly wouldn't stay for pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: geordiemma
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fine but the staff were a little snooty and the location was great for the central train station but not so great for most of the tourist attractions.
